citation.article-title: Limnobacter thiooxidans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel thiosulfate-oxidizing bacterium isolated from freshwater lake sediment.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Limnobacter (Lim.no.bac'ter. Gr. n. limnos lake; M.L. n. bacter rod; M.L. masc. n. Limnobacter lake rod, referring to the isolation of the type species from lake sediment)
Cells are Gram-negative, slightly curved rods that are motile by single polar flagella.
Polyhydroxybutyrate is stored as a reserve material.
Carboxylic acids and amino acids are used as energy and carbon sources, but no carbohydrates or polyols are used.
Thiosulfate is oxidized to sulfate in the presence of an organic carbon source.
Phylogenetically affiliated to the Burkholderia group within the β-Proteobacteria.
The type species is Limnobacter thiooxidans.
